Carnivore.name: Carnivore
Carnivore.blurb: Whenever Cho'Gath kills a unit, he recovers Health and Mana. The values restored increase with Cho'Gath's level.
Carnivore.description: Innate: Whenever Cho'Gath kills an enemy or destroys an enemy structure, he restores  20 − 71 (based on level) health and  3.5 − 7.75 (based on level) mana.

Rupture.name: Rupture
Rupture.blurb: Ruptures the ground at target location, popping enemy units into the air, dealing damage and slowing them.
Rupture.description: Active: Cho'Gath gains  sight of the target area which, after a 0.625 seconds delay, he ruptures dealing  magic damage and  knocking up enemies hit for 1 second,  slowing them by 60% for 1.5 seconds afterwards.
Rupture.notes: * The animation is visible in brush and in fog of war.

Feral Scream.name: Feral Scream
Feral Scream.blurb: Cho'Gath unleashes a terrible scream at enemies in a cone, dealing magic damage and Silencing enemies for a few seconds.
Feral Scream.description: Active: Cho'Gath roars in the target direction, dealing magic damage to enemies in a cone and  silencing them for a duration.

Vorpal Spikes.name: Vorpal Spikes
Vorpal Spikes.blurb: Cho'Gath's attacks release deadly spikes, dealing damage and slowing all enemy units in front of him.
Vorpal Spikes.description: Active: Cho'Gath's next 3 basic attacks within 6 seconds have  50 bonus range and launch a volley of spikes in a line, dealing magic damage and applying a decaying  slow over the next 1.5 seconds to enemies hit.
Vorpal Spikes.leveling:
Magic Damage:
22 / 34 / 46 / 58 / 70 (+ 30% AP) (+ 3% (+ 0.5% per  Feast stack) of target's maximum health)
Maximum Damage:
66 / 102 / 138 / 174 / 210 (+ 90% AP) (+ 9% (+ 1.5% per  Feast stack) of target's maximum health)
Slow:
30 / 35 / 40 / 45 / 50%
Vorpal Spikes.description2: Vorpal Spikes resets Cho'Gath's basic attack timer.
Vorpal Spikes.notes:
* Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to secondary targets.
  Rylai's Crystal Scepter and  Liandry's Torment's passives apply to every target hit by the spikes.
 Cho'Gath's size factors into how wide of a hitbox Vorpal Spikes has. External size modifiers ( Wild Growth) contribute.

Feast.name: Feast
Feast.blurb: Devours an enemy unit, dealing a high amount of true damage. If the target is killed, Cho'Gath grows, gaining maximum Health.
Feast.description: Active: Cho'Gath attempts to eat the target enemy, dealing  true damage. Against non-champions, the base damage is increased to 1000.
Feast.leveling:
True Damage to Champions:
300 / 475 / 650 (+ 50% AP) (+ 10% bonus health)
Feast.description2: If Feast kills its target, Cho'Gath gains a Feast stack. Only 6 stacks can be gained from non-epic monsters or minions.
Feast.description3: Each stack grants  bonus health, which can stack up to 255 times, as well as  bonus attack range and increased size that stack up to 17 / 13 / 10 (based on Rank) times, for a maximum  75 bonus attack range.
Feast.leveling3:
Bonus Health Per Stack:
80 / 120 / 160 bonus health
Bonus Attack Range Per Stack:
4.5 / 6 / 7.5
Feast.notes:
* The health and attack range bonuses from collected stacks will increase as Cho'Gath ranks up the ability.
 If an enemy's health is low enough that they will die from Feast a glowing red ring appears underneath them.
 Nineteen stacks of max rank Feast with no other HP items (3040 bonus hp) is the point when  Cinderhulk will give more health than  Warmog's Armor or any other item.
 Each stack of Feast increases the damage by 8 / 12 / 16.
 If Cho'Gath loses sight of his target during the cast time, Feast will not go on cooldown. It will go on cooldown if the target dies during the cast time.
